Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; white slip; worn glaze on edges of rim; on top of rim simple guilloche pattern with dots in interstices; on body, painted decoration consisting of part of sphinx, to right, with foreleg raised and touching the large floral in front of her; inverted rays and simple crosses as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd is not Chian. The sherd belongs to the same vase as Brussels A.1769, possibly joining it. Iren allocates the Brussels fragment to the London dinos group (IM 52 (2002) 201, no.41).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 38, p. 245, no. 280, pl. 35)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 132 note 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1093)
